page.title: 19Farming Poem The Tractor
page.content: He started the tractor,its engine was creaking, The wheels moved with a terrible squeaking, It shot out the farmyard with incredible speed, And as for the animals they took no heed. The front of the bonnet was covered in oil, The engine was certainly having to toil. Suddenly his field came into sight, So he turned the wheel with the fiercest of might, He lowered the plough to the ground, It started to make a churning sound. Soon the field was completely finished, But the fuel in his tank had certainly diminished.
